title.narrative: Assisting Myanmars Conflict Affected and Displaced People

description.narrative: Assisting Myanmars Conflict Affected and Displaced People in Thailand

Over the last 30 years, around 250,000 ethnic minority refugees from Myanmar had sought protection in the Thai-Myanmar border camps. In 2015, approximately 110,000 refugees remain in camps with poor shelter and limited access to education and food security. With less and less humanitarian support from donors. At the same time, in 2014, the Thai refugee policy became more strict, and refugees are not allowed to move or work outside the camps. This program supports food assistance in the Thai refugee camps Ban Don Yang, Mae Ra Ma Luang, Mae La Oon and Ban Mae Surin to the most vulnerable 30,000 refugees.
